resources.string: Elephants are the largest land mammals on earth and have distinctly massive bodies, large ears, and long trunks.

1. Elephants are the world's largest land animal. 
 2. They have around 150,000 muscles in their trunk. 
 3. Elephant tusks are enlarged incisor teeth. 
 4. Elephant calves are able to stand within 20 minutes of birth. 
 5. Wild elephants can live for up to 60-70 years.
